page.title: 11Motorcycle Trials, Mow Cop
page.content: Along the road from Mow Cop to Congleton, just beyond the parking areas set out to view Cheshire, there is an area set aside for motorcycle trials competition. Run by the Congleton & District MC Club, which is affiliated to the Cheshire Centre Autocycle Union (ACU), trials over the rough hillside are held about 12 times a year. About 100 riders take part and are catagarised by age. The first Â£Kickstart' BBC programme on trials bike riding was held here in November 1981. The land is owned by the farmer Mr. Davies at Limekiln Farm. In a trials competition a series of obstacles are created using the natural terrain. The riders then have to ride through these areas without putting a foot down against time.
